title: Growth in Godliness
shortSummary: 2 Peter Chapter 1 emphasizes the divine power granted to believers for living a godly life and encourages the addition of spiritual virtues to faith. Peter reminds believers of the certainty of Christ’s majesty and the reliability of prophetic Scripture, urging diligence in faith to secure their calling and election.
timeline: c. AD 64-65, during the later years of the Apostle Peter's ministry, shortly before his martyrdom

keyCharacters.name: Simon Peter
keyCharacters.description: The author of the epistle, an apostle of Jesus Christ, writing to encourage believers to grow in faith and godliness.

keyCharacters.name: Jesus Christ
keyCharacters.description: Referred to as Lord and Savior, whose divine power enables believers to live godly lives; His majesty and coming are affirmed by Peter.

definitions.definition: The valuable and genuine faith shared by believers, obtained through the righteousness of God and Jesus Christ.
The spiritual qualities and character of God that believers partake in through God's promises, enabling them to overcome worldly corruption.
The divine invitation and selection of believers for salvation and eternal life, which must be confirmed by diligent spiritual growth.
Scriptural messages inspired by the Holy Spirit, not of human origin or private interpretation, serving as a sure guide for faith.

outline.heading: Greeting and Divine Empowerment
outline.description: Peter opens with a greeting to believers who share precious faith and highlights that God's divine power has granted all things necessary for life and godliness through knowledge of Christ.

outline.heading: Growth in Christian Virtues
outline.description: Believers are exhorted to diligently add virtue, knowledge, temperance, patience, godliness, brotherly kindness, and charity to their faith, ensuring they are fruitful in the knowledge of Jesus Christ and secure in their calling.

outline.heading: Peter’s Reminder and Encouragement
outline.description: Peter commits to continually reminding believers of these truths, knowing his death is near, so that they may remember and remain steadfast after his departure.

outline.heading: Eyewitness Testimony of Christ’s Majesty
outline.description: Peter asserts that his message is not based on myths but on eyewitness experience of Christ’s majesty, including the voice from heaven declaring Jesus as God’s beloved Son.

outline.heading: The Certainty of Prophecy
outline.description: Peter encourages believers to hold firmly to the prophetic word, which is inspired by the Holy Spirit and not subject to private interpretation, providing a sure foundation for faith.

application: Diligently cultivate spiritual virtues such as knowledge, patience, and charity to grow in godliness and reflect Christ’s character.
Regularly remind yourself and others of the truth of the gospel and the certainty of Christ’s return to strengthen faith and perseverance.
Trust in the divine inspiration and authority of Scripture as the unchanging and reliable guide for Christian living.
Make your calling and election sure by living a life marked by obedience and continual spiritual growth.

keyVerses.text: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights that God’s power equips believers with everything needed for a godly life through knowing Christ.

keyVerses.text: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge; And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness; And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.
keyVerses.significance: These verses outline the essential Christian virtues that believers must actively develop to grow spiritually and bear fruit.

keyVerses.text: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.
keyVerses.significance: Peter affirms the truth of the gospel based on his firsthand experience of Jesus’ glory, countering false teachings.

keyVerses.text: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the divine inspiration of Scripture, assuring believers of its authority and reliability.
